subject: Re: Need help with a one word recording
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Ron, it's interesting, but I cannot make it out any differently 
than "Evedot."  Not sure if it is an audio chopped bit or a 
communication of some sort.  ;)

I just uploaded a file from this morning in my folder entitled, spirit-
12808, and it is direct recorded from a 12-470 (older version) piped 
directly into my recorder, but I first added an audio amplifier (into 
the line) to pick up my voice and a head set to adjust both volumes (of 
the radio and the mic) before recording (and to analyze the responses 
in real time).  I basically used Mike Coletta's set up he did with the 
ghost box, minus the ghost box and direct recording the session.  
Listen to the audio, as it is much clearer and may provide a better set-
up for adjusting it than direct plugging it into the audio recorder.

Hope this helps.

LC
http://www.AngelsGhosts.com

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ron Lederer <ronriko@...> wrote:
>
> I recorded this with a RS 469 patched direct into by handheld 
recorder.  I hear a two sylable word over the background noise.  Hoping 
I can get some help from the group to define the word or words.  
Thanks   Ron L
>
